Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.santorini.model.gameoperations.expansion

Class Expandable<T,​S,​U extends Expansion<T,​S>,​V extends Expandable<T,​S,​U,​V>>

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.santorini.model.gameoperations.expansion.Expandable<T,​S,​U,​V>
Type Parameters:
T - The type of the object that refines the expandable's behaviour
S - The type of the supported expansions' marker
U - The type of supported expansions
V - The type of expandable that can be merged with the expandable
Direct Known Subclasses:
SimpleExpandable
public abstract class Expandable<T,​S,​U extends Expansion<T,​S>,​V extends Expandable<T,​S,​U,​V>>
extends java.lang.Object
Brief Represents an expandable object. Expandable refers to the ability of an object's behaviour of being refined by adding to it custom expansions. The expansions can be of two types (expansive and restrictive)
See Also:
Any supported expansion must extend this base class

      expandable - Boolean true if expansions allowed
      applicable - Boolean true if applications on expansions allowed

      public abstract void addExpansion​(U expansion, java.lang.Integer index) throws ExpansionAllowanceException, MarkerLessExpansionAdded

      Parameters:

      index - the position
      Throws:
      MarkerLessExpansionAdded - Thrown if the adding expansion has an empty list of markers

    • merge

      public abstract void merge​(V expandable) throws ExpansionAllowanceException
      Brief Merges the expandable with another supported expandable. Merging them means that the expandable will add to himself all the merging expandable's expansions
      Parameters:
      expandable - The expandable being merged
      Throws:
      ExpansionAllowanceException

    • applyExpansions

      void applyExpansions​(java.util.List<U> expansions, java.util.function.Consumer<U> consumer) throws ApplicationAllowanceException
      Brief Applies all the expansions previously added to the expandable. It only applies filtered expansions.
      Parameters:
      expansions - The expansions being applied
      consumer - The consumer that must accept each expansion as input
      Throws:
      ApplicationAllowanceException

      Brief Filters the expansion using the filter
      Parameters:
      expansion - The expansion being filtered
      Returns:
      Boolean true if the expansion meets any match with respect to the filter, false otherwise
